meta.name: description
meta.content: Campbell Union School District provides education beyond the expected for preschool to 8th grade students in Campbell, Los Gatos, San Jose, Santa Clara, and Saratoga.
Campbell Union School District provides education beyond the expected for preschool to 8th grade students in Campbell, Los Gatos, San Jose, Santa Clara, and Saratoga.

meta.name: twitter:description
meta.content: Campbell Union School District provides education beyond the expected for preschool to 8th grade students in Campbell, Los Gatos, San Jose, Santa Clara, and Saratoga.

link.title: District News • Campbell Union School District
Campbell Union School District

button.class: navbar-toggle pull-left btn search btn-default btn-cusd-text

div.strong: All schools are closed through June 11th, 2020. More on our COVID-19 Resources page.

div.style: clear: both; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px

div.h2: April 17 Briefing: 1st Distance Learning Week Complete

p.span: A message from Superintendent Viramontez during the COVID19 Shelter in Place

img.alt: laptop with cyber strongman and words

div.h2: Protections fortified for online learning
Overcoming Language Barriers During Distance Learning
April 8 COVID19 Superintendent's Update

p.span: As Spring Break ends, district moves into new phase of distance learning.

img.alt: worker preparing to-go meals at school

div.h2: District services pause during scheduled Spring Break

p.span: Meals still available thanks to community partners. See updates on our COVID-19 page.

img.alt: dorr with person posting a sign that says Closed

div.h2: April 3 Update from the Superintendent

p.span: Video message about extended school closure from Dr. Viramontez

div.h2: Schools Closed Remainder of the Year

img.alt: sign that reads: coronavirus school is closed

div.h2: School Closures Extended

p.span: UPDATE FOR MARCH 25-APRIL 3: Keeping you informed during the COVID-19 shelter-in-place.

img.alt: boy looking at screen with several faces and some obscured

div.h2: Protect Student Privacy: Think Before You Post

p.span: It's fun to share. Please use care.

img.alt: lunch bag with words: Grab and Go

div.h2: Student Meals During Spring Break and Beyond

p.span: Updated schedule: Grab and go meals available Monday through Friday.

img.alt: woman in front of students demonstrating lesson

div.h2: New Event Inspires Inquiry and Innovation

p.span: Third graders now more curious about the world around them and how they can contribute to it

div.h2: Students Address Global Issues in TEDx Student Talks

p.span: School event covered students' research and ideas about real-world social and scientific issues

div.h2: Students to Learn about Census 2020

p.span: An accurate census count benefits our schools and community.

div.h2: CUSD’s Preschools Among Region's Best

p.span: State and Regional Agencies Give High Marks to District’s Early Education Programs

div.h2: Great News for the Rosemary Library

p.span: Grant to fund refresh of school library this spring.

img.alt: teacher testing project made by students

div.h2: Sparking Curiosity. Encouraging Innovation.

img.alt: multiple photos of students showing their work

div.h2: Lessons that Stick: Frog Exhibition

p.span: Interdisciplinary lessons get Rosemary students excited about science, art, language, and fly-catching amphibians.

img.alt: teacher at whiteboard with two students

div.h2: Inspiring Creativity, Growth Mindset and Critical Thinking

img.alt: two girls smiling with their project

div.h2: Design Thinking Approach Spreads to More CUSD Schools

p.span: The approach to teaching core academics is energizing students and teachers!

div.h2: Students Cook Up Creations After School

p.span: Creativity and competition are baked into middle school extended learning opportunity, thanks to support from community partners.

div.h2: So Many Reasons to Vote!

p.span: Are You Registered to Vote? Deadline is Feb. 18th.

div.h2: Simple Precautions Can Help Against Viruses

p.span: Currently, risk is low to county residents. Universal precautions recommended to limit spread.

div.h2: Plan Ahead for 2020

p.span: Academic calendar approved for 2020-21 school year

div.h2: Two District Schools Earn State Award

p.span: Village and Castlemont Schools are 2020 California Distinguished Schools Award recipients.

img.alt: parent and child walk to school

div.h2: Save the Date: Enrollment Opens Jan. 21

p.span: Online enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year begins January 21, 2020.

div.h2: Gratitude and Greetings from the Superintendent
County Committee Approves New Trustee Areas

p.span: Process continues to State Board of Education

div.h2: School Registration Begins Jan. 21

p.span: Parents are invited to preview our schools and programs now through February 14th.

div.h2: Looking for Leaders

p.span: If you live or work in Campbell, this opportunity is for you. Dec. 20 deadline.

div.h2: Board Sets 5 New Trustee Areas for School District

p.span: Proposed trustee area map goes to County Committee for approval Dec. 9, 2019

div.h2: District Sends Thanksgiving Greetings

p.span: Together, we make a difference for students.

div.h2: Board Votes to Place Funding Measure on March 2020 Ballot

p.span: “We are committed to protecting the quality of education for our elementary and middle school students,” said Board President Michael Snyder.

img.alt: woman standing in from of class and talking

div.h2: Digital Life Class Changes Lives

p.span: “Because of this class, I have more confidence and want to learn more!”

img.alt: students interacting with high tech device

div.h2: $1 Museum Entry for Our Families!

p.span: Museum for All program expands access to San Jose's Tech Interactive.

div.h2: School Safety is Job One

p.span: Superintendent Viramontez explains district-wide measures to promote safe learning environments.

div.h2: Are You Thinking What We're Thinking?

p.span: DEADLINE EXTENDED to 11/22. Join our Community Thoughtexchange.

img.alt: panelists on stage at Child Disrupted

div.h2: Experts Caution “Strive for Balance” With Technology Use

p.span: Panelists at "Child, Disrupted" documentary screening discussed technology use and child development.

img.alt: female teacher with young boy smiling at camera

div.h2: Maintaining Quality Instruction for Students

p.span: Governing Board discussing a potential local funding measure that would help maintain quality education in our schools

div.h2: Map of New Trustee Areas Are Being Developed

img.alt: smiling girl on floor with book

div.h2: Programs Keep Students Engaged After School

p.span: "Lights On After School" events celebrate benefits of after school programs for students

div.h2: Bringing Out Students’ Best and Maintaining Quality Instruction

img.alt: male teacher smiling with students at table

div.h2: Sherman Oaks Teacher Represents District at County Awards Celebration

img.alt: boy in school with superman symbol behind him

div.h2: Make It a Super Year!

p.span: Parents and Teachers Make the Difference for Students.

div.h2: CUSD School Named 2019 National Blue Ribbon School

p.span: Forest Hill Elementary School is one of 362 in the U.S. receiving the award

div.h2: Governing Board Votes to Change Elections

p.span: District will transition to by-trustee area elections. Public input welcome.

img.alt: hands holding cell phone with alert message

div.h2: Stay Informed! New Notifications App

p.span: Parents and guardians asked for more control over how they receive school notices.

img.alt: group of students who won awards

div.h2: Rising Young Authors Celebrated at Community Event

p.span: "These students are impressive," said Superintendent Shelly Viramontez.

img.alt: mom and daughter smiling at school

div.h2: Showing Up Matters in Every Grade

p.span: From their first day in Kindergarten to their last day of high school, attendance matters!

div.h2: Great People. Great Kids. Join Our team as a Recreation Leader

p.span: Our after school program is hiring recreation leaders for several campus locations. Tell a Friend!

div.h2: Creating Brighter Minds Every Day

img.alt: audience listens to a 2018 student author at podium

div.h2: Community Celebrates Student Authors

p.span: Our 2019 Rising Young Authors are bound for success!

img.alt: man's hand holding cell phone that shows

div.h2: Schools to Test Alert System

p.span: On Friday evening, Sept. 6, 2019, our schools will TEST our emergency notification system.

div.h2: “Future of Learning” is Focus for District, Partners

p.span: "Our strategic planning committee identified the skills and competencies that our students will need to prepare them for their futures—futures with so much variability in what they're going to be facing as adults," said District Superintendent Shelly Viramontez.

img.alt: video about Profile of a Graduate

div.h2: Profile Of A Graduate: Their Future Depends On It

p.span: "Profile of a Graduate" is Campbell Union School District’s commitment to students and the community.

img.alt: 4 students sitting on floor, smiling at camera

div.h2: Accountability Plan Maps Bright Future for Students

p.span: Local Control & Accountability Plan (LCAP) sets 2019-20 focus for programs and funds to ensure students are college and future ready.

div.h2: Ideas to Encourage Summer Reading

p.span: Numerous studies show that being able to read proficiently opens the door to a world of success.

div.h2: State Test Results Will Be Digital This year

p.span: Individual reports of students' CAASPP results will be available electronically.

img.alt: parents hold child with a graduation cap drawn above child's head

div.h2: Give the Best from the Beginning

p.span: Preschool and infant programs in San Jose, Campbell, Los Gatos and Saratoga

div.h2: Eighth Graders Celebrate Promotion

p.span: Hundreds of family and friends braved the heat and attended promotion ceremonies at Rolling Hills and Monroe middle schools.

div.h2: San Jose Council Celebrates Principal Schmaedick

img.alt: student works on homework with after school staff

div.h2: Grant Funding Extends Student Opportunities

p.span: Funds increase access to quality after school and summer learning programs

div.h2: District Celebrates Award Winners

p.span: May 23 Celebration of Excellence is District's employee and volunteer appreciation event.

img.alt: students hold banner at special games parade

div.h2: Athletes Compete at Special Games

p.span: A day of positive achievements sponsored by Kiwanis

div.h2: CSI Impresses Visitors from South Korea

p.span: Our district and Campbell School of Innovation were proud hosts to a delegation from Seoul Metropolitan Office of Education.

div.h2: District Celebrates Literacy

p.span: Annual Writing Fair showcases student writing from every school.

div.h2: Wellness Week Going Strong

p.span: Monroe Middle School hosts presentations and activities to help students, staff and families stay healthy.

div.h2: Make Time for Mental Health

p.span: Stressed? Depressed? Trying Your Best? Come to Wellness Week Activities!

div.h2: District to Reduce $2 million from Budget

p.span: Community support and solid fiscal management has protected schools from worse impacts. Download report.

p.span: Work will advance STEM education and foster students developing 21st century problem-solving skills that are critical to any career.

div.h2: Tweets by @CampbellUSD

li.div: Apr 16th 9:30 AMSee what's new on our COVID19 resources page. Distance learning links. Wellness activities. Dental emergency services. https://buff.ly/3coSmJi https://t.co/2gBANN62I1

Apr 16th 6:08 AM@CAgovernor: Governor @GavinNewsom announced new initiatives to support the millions of California workers who have lost jobs or wages as a result of the #COVID19 pandemic.#CaliforniaForAll #StayHomeSaveLives https://t.co/SW5RmAX8O7
Apr 16th 5:58 AMOur @campbellusd teachers are workin’ it as we all adjust to #distancelearning. #StayHome #cusdrockstar https://twitter.com/mshaughs/status/1250645646555484160
li.blockquote: Favorite part of my day? Teaching! A writing lesson! Live!! Via Zoom & GSlides... With my 2nds! It’s the first time in over 4 weeks I’ve felt like I was actually teaching... felt so good & my Ss participation and excitement rocked!! #K2CanToo #CUSDRockstar #caedchat #2ndchat

li.div: Apr 10th 4:19 AM@campbellsupt: Nice to see we aren’t the only ones who realize the need to lead with heart ❤️ now more than ever. Flexing our PoG competency of Empathy @EdLeader21 https://t.co/wUtEjgz6Dj

Apr 9th 6:32 AM@HealthySCC: (1/4) We want to give a big thank you to all of our community members for your continued commitment to slowing the spread of #COVID19. We may be seeing the curve start to flatten and are projecting that it is likely that our hospitals can meet demands through the end of May. https://t.co/BSQ8hvJdzk

Apr 6th 5:22 AM@LenaBundtzen: How to Talk to Little Learners About Coronavirus can be E.A.S.Y.: Eye level - speak to children at their eye level Age appropriate language Soft voice Yield for a moment to allow children to share thoughts or ask questions! https://t.co/KibTImE7Ds

Apr 6th 5:17 AM@campbellsupt: Relax on kids' academics in COVID-19 crisis: Stanford expert So much consternation about this new DL platform. How will grades be provided? How will I work and make sure my child is doing their Distance Learning? and so much more. Advice from an expert https://t.co/wjSY5SZKQA

Apr 5th 5:36 AMThank you Governor. Our teachers and staff are digging deep - persevering and innovating- on behalf of students and families. #cusdrockstar https://twitter.com/GavinNewsom/status/1246078691601289218
li.blockquote:
THANK YOU --
To all the teachers that have turned their living rooms into virtual classrooms and lessons into creative take-home packets.
To all the school employees that are making sure our kids stay fed and our students stay healthy. We are in debt to you.

li.div: Apr 2nd 5:40 PMNeed a hand? We have a helpful list of community resources on our covid-19 resources page. https://buff.ly/2R709Do #cusdrockstars #covid19 @campbellusd https://t.co/6ePEPWQfka

Apr 2nd 7:21 AMSchool buildings will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year. The school year has not ended; it has transitioned from in-person classroom instruction to instruction and support for students through distance learning options. https://buff.ly/3dNQCKS https://t.co/CpeGjsQUz5
Apr 2nd 6:59 AMSee an update from @campbellsupt Dr. Viramontez about developments in the COVID19 school closures and distance learning. https://buff.ly/2tHUHya https://t.co/Pb2kKTJx5C

li.blockquote: Our schools keeping spirit alive during this challenging times. https://t.co/E7ZCLL1oRI

li.div: Mar 31st 1:52 PMWatch for updates for updates about new resources and support for @campbellusd students and families. Visit the district's COVID19 resources page. https://buff.ly/2Ui2Cf1 https://t.co/LoOp0uzRwk

Mar 29th 8:53 PM@CAgovernor: ➡️ 90-day grace period for mortgage payments ➡️ No negative credit impacts resulting from relief ➡️ 60-day moratorium on new foreclosure sales or evictions + more
For more information on CA's Major Relief Package: https://t.co/snYe5vmHg6 https://t.co/tDtoKBRW3y

Mar 28th 6:22 AM@LenaBundtzen: Students can access GO NOODLE online. Go Noodle has short activities addressing mindfulness, reduction of stress/anxiety, fun dance activities for indoor exercise. https://t.co/2v7pnOW9cO

Mar 27th 6:17 AM@FamilyELab: Today is International Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) Day, and we invite you to celebrate with us. #FASTalk supports SEL through providing tools that promote social, emotional, and academic skill development. Learn more: https://t.co/X5T2zzyT0d #FELfamilies #familyengagement
Mar 25th 4:18 PMOur sympathies and condolences to those who have lost loved ones to the Coronavirus. https://twitter.com/HealthySCC/status/1242924655624814594
li.blockquote: We have 84 new cases of #COVID19 in Santa Clara County, now totaling 459. We are very sorry to announce one additional death from #COVID19, bringing the total to 17. We express our heartfelt condolences to their family and friends. For updates, visit https://t.co/lcx5wwIhOc https://t.co/g2x6kNlUN4

li.div: Mar 25th 12:15 PMSanta Clara County and 5 others announced that school closures will extend to May 1. Please see the latest message from our superintendent: https://buff.ly/2tHUHya https://t.co/Sg82kwfKpD
Mar 23rd 4:51 PM@campbellsupt: So proud of our staff making sure our Ss are getting their lunches and their learning materials ⁦@RosemaryCUSD⁩ ⁦@lynhavenlynx1⁩ @shelterinplace https://t.co/9tuwatJlaO
Mar 23rd 8:24 AMNew lessons added to our COVID-19 resources page. We encourage families to check daily for new resources and information. https://buff.ly/3dieV3z https://t.co/3XnMJgvRHj

Mar 23rd 8:19 AMWatch Out For Coronavirus Fraud - From fake cures to fraudulent donation appeals, authorities are warning Bay Area residents to be on the lookout for coronavirus fraud. https://buff.ly/33DFCLH https://t.co/dxPN1M2o0t

Mar 18th 9:28 AMIn light of the Governor’s announcement last night, we are pivoting our planning to include the probability that schools may remain closed beyond the original date. We will provide more info through our normal systems, including our covid19 webpage. https://buff.ly/2Ui2Cf1 https://t.co/Bd6fZ2mVnd

Mar 17th 6:00 PM@LenaBundtzen: Just For Kids: A Comic Exploring The New Coronavirus https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2020/02/28/809580453/just-for-kids-a-comic-exploring-the-new-coronavirus?utm_campaign=storyshare&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social
